Summary: Saw multi-colored still object in the sky
divs: Sighting DetailsI was sitting in my kitchen, browsing the web on my laptop, and looked out the window and saw something in the sky, approx. 30 degrees above the horizon. The shape of it looked unusual to me, so I grabbed my digital camera and went outside. The object wasn't moving, didn't make any noise. I pointed my camera at it, zoomed in as much as possible and took a few shots. I watched it for a couple of minutes, and it did not move at all. When I saw it, it looked white, almost like a glowing grain of rice in the sky, a few degrees off-vertical from my viewpoint. I thought it was something relatively close-by, not a star. My perception was it was maybe 5-7 miles away. After watching it for a while, I was tired so I went back inside and went to bed. The next day I transferred the pictures to my laptop and only one of them captured the object. I was surprised to see it was actually multi-colored (it appeared white to the naked eye). As you can see in the picture, if you zoom in 100%, stars show up without motion blur. This leads me to believe the multi-colored object also has little or no motion blur. If you have some idea of what I saw, I'd appreciate your opinion. Thanks, Dan Cogswell
